intro: Urena armitiana var. typica, commonly known as Indian mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters. The plant produces showy, yellow-centered flowers surrounded by five broad, pale green to pinkish-purple petals. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a velvety texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
